name: Silphium
Relationship: Compare: ARAL.; COPAIVA.; TEREBE.; CUBEB.; SAMB.; SILPHION CYRENAICUM (phthisis pulmonum, with incessant cough, profuse night-sweats, emaciation, etc.); POLYGONUM AVICULARE (has been found useful in phthisis, when given in material doses of the mother tincture); SALVIA (tickling cough). ARUM DRACONTIUM (loose cough at night on lying down). JUSTICIA ADHATODA (bronchial catarrh, hoarseness, oversensitive).

Respiratory: Irritation of posterior nares, involving mucous membranes of nasal passages with constriction of supraorbital region
Cough with expectoration profuse, stringy, frothy, light-colored
Catarrh, with copious, stringy, mucous discharges
Excited by sense of mucus rattling in chest and worse by drafts of air
Desire to hawk and scrape throat

details: Is used in various forms of asthma and chronic bronchitis. Catarrh of bladder. Catarrhal influenza. Dysentery; attack preceded by constipated stools covered with white mucus.
dosage: Third potency. Lower TRITURATIONS preferred by some.
